intro: Rosa seposita, commonly known as the clustered rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. The plant produces fragrant, pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne in clusters. Rosa seposita is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
